story.storykicker: Comedy show Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah is now in Limca Book of Records as the longest running comedy fiction show.
story.storybody:
Few days back, Balika Vadhu made news for entering Limca Book of Records as longest running daily fiction soap in Hindi. Now it's Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah's turn to set the national record. The comedy show has been acknowledged as the longest running comedy fiction show by Limca Book of Records.

Produced by Neela Telefilms and conceived and designed by Asit Kumar Modi, TMKOC has been airing on SAB TV since July 28, 2008. The 1700th episode aired on June 22, 2015.

 

Proud of our show #TMKOC for bagging the longest running fictional comedy show by Limca Books of Record @LBR_KOhttps://t.co/n9R1trOM0m

ï¿½?? SAB TV (@sabtv) June 3, 2016

 

Also read: Disha Vakani ecstatic as Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah completes 1900 episodes

"We had started telecasting the show on 28 July 2008 inspite of adverse comments and advice from people on the very concept and story of Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah . However, I was confident and so was my entire team and actors. We knew that there was a gaping hole in the entertainment industry for a family entertainer," Asit Kumarr Modi told The Times of India.

"Today we stand vindicated. This acknowledgement from LIMCA Book of Records proves that show is well liked and has a constant as well as big fan following. Otherwise no show can sustain for so long on any channel. I thank my channel SAB TV for trusting my instincts about the concept," he added.

Congrats to Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah team.
